channel.title: Interserver Meeting Area
channel.description:
recently read about this idea on another game.
I'll take the 2 most popular servers as an example. Someone creates a 'InterServer' where RSCA and RSCE's servers both have connections to.
RSCA and RSCE will have to of course, make changes to their server to support this (won't be too hard)
a player on RSCA talks to an NPC which decides to teleport him to this interserver meeting room. (example) He gets teleported to a place similar to the RSCD Mod Room. in this room will contain everyone on your server, and RSCE (just their appearances, armor/weapons, names and all chatting will work) NOTHING MORE. no trading/dropping, nothing inside this area.
When a player from RSCA gets teleported to the Interserver, the RSCA server will tell the Interserver that he is now there. Interserver will inform RSCA server, to tell that player about all the people that are in the Interserver, the Interserver will also tell RSCE about this new players entrance, which RSCE will then tell everyone whos already in the Interserver that the player has joined.
You will be able to talk/walk around in 1, which will be like a virtual room between both servers, allowing players to chill out between their favorite servers.
I could write this Interserver and provide anyone whos capable of implementing this with some documentation (but you will need to know how to code)
who knows, maybe could even set it up to have server PK wars (of course, nobody gets any loot due to both servers difference in the economy) but still fun to see whos a stronger server etc, even if 1 server is all flat 99s due to the speed)
for people who still don't understand. simply you can log on a server that supports this, talk to an NPC and get teleported to a special area where you can communicate with anyone on any server that supports this, and is inside this room.

item.title: Interserver Meeting Area
item.dc:creator: @ownagesbot ownagesbot
item.description:
@ownagesbot wrote:

Or the interserver meeting area can consist of a chatroom / activity area and a multi-server dueling area, in the multi-server dueling area you compete for your server, the interserver collects the data, therefore you can have ranked server duels etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Interserver Meeting Area
item.dc:creator: @Ecko Ecko
item.description:
@Ecko wrote:

Only way this would be cool is:

When you’re about to enter wilderness that warning thing comes up and you press close: it reconnects the user from whatever private server to a server that has only the wilderness landscape.

Basically, when you go to PK, you’re PKing with everyone else who is PKing on the big RSC private servers.

Read full topic

item.title: Interserver Meeting Area
item.dc:creator: @KO9 KO9
item.description:
@KO9 wrote:

i don’t really have the time to do this at the mo[quote=“nacional, post:23, topic:324578”][quote author=KO9 link=topic=420955.msg3093411#msg3093411 date=1263081618]

How about just make a server that would get rid of all the competition so you only need one server

I don’t think this could ever happen, since people have such different idea on a great server. Some people want
custom some don’t, some want p2p others want f2p, some want 120 cap some want the classic 99 cap.

Also any admins who read this, post if you would do what I suggested yes or no? And if no
please explain your reasoning.

No.

Will be abused for personal benefit. Advertising, virus infection, etc. There is no gaurentee that it wouldn’t and I don’t trust anyone on moparscape or in this community (outside of close friends) with that sort of responsibility.
[/quote]

Well IMO, you guys would be the ones who administer this because you guys have the most stable source(only

one I think that can handle massive amounts of players online at a time) and are most respected/trusted in rsc development. So that would mean no virus spread. Also sure there might be some people who advertise but there
will prob be a mass amount of mods regulating. Each server could assign like 5 mods and that will prob be more than
enough.[/quote]

I don’t really have the time at the moment. It might be something i’d concider doing in a few months time though.

Read full topic

item.title: Interserver Meeting Area
item.dc:creator: @The_AFKer The_AFKer
item.description:
@The_AFKer wrote:

Peeter:

Creating a chatroom is kinda pointless imo. 90% of the people who will understand how to use it already use MSN/vent/irc etc. The only viable application I could see is “server wars” and perhaps cross-server PMs.

Read full topic

item.title: Interserver Meeting Area
item.dc:creator: @mapu mapu
item.description:
@mapu wrote:

xEnt:

with that idea, ofc, KO9 is the only person id trust from this entire community to run that ‘PK’ server. it’s actually a great idea if we set up some server like that, where basically everyone starts the same level (flat 99s, or whatever) with all gears etc, when registrating you choose either your from RSCA or RSCE, you have a little tag ingame showing who your from, your not allowed to attack anyone of your servers players, and theres a kill count to see whos the stronger server, or a huge custom DM arena where 1 side theres 150 players from each server, then they all run in, until last person standing wins.

Sounds kinda like my last server idea.

Read full topic

Wow, pretty great we already got one admin of the 2 biggest servers to agree now let’s see k09’s decision.
